reviews.text:
I live on this block and finally decided to give Meatball NYC a try - but it was such a disappointment. The place was empty at lunchtime (as it usually seems to be), and now I understand why. When our food came out, my partnerâ€™s $27 dish was literally frozen - not just cold or lukewarm, but still iced solid in the center.

We told the waiter, and his only response was â€œokâ€ before picking up the plate to take it back to the kitchen to â€œreheatâ€ it. That was enough for us, we didnâ€™t stay to find out what would happen next and just left.

For a $27 plate, serving something frozen is completely unacceptable. I really wanted to like this place since itâ€™s in the neighborhood, but after that experience, we wonâ€™t be back.

Es un lugar relajado donde venden las mÃ¡s deliciosas albÃ³ndigas a la boloÃ±esa, la salsa estÃ¡ muy bien sazonada. Las albÃ³ndigas tipo alitas bÃºfalo tambiÃ©n tienen muy buen sabor. Incluso la coliflor asada es crujiente y bien condimentada.

Luv the food, great service.
Im a repeat customer,  I brought new friends and i will definitely be back.
Thank you meatball chef and team. YUM

Three meatballs cost $17 plus tax during happy hour. They taste great but seriouslyâ€¦? My salad was overdressed, the â€œgarlicâ€ bread had just butter and cost $11.95 when they charged me without notification for Parmesan that I wanted since I canâ€™t stand lathered mozzarella on crunchy garlic bread and it was just the powdered Kraft kind not even the real shaved. I was having a migraine so I couldnâ€™t stand hearing some of the music that had â€œsuicidalâ€ playing. At least it was good service. But the prices are ludicrous
Delicious! Friendly, great atmosphere!
FleischbÃ¤llchen sehr lecker ğŸ˜‹
Stopped in for a quick drink. Happy hour specials. Bar and outside seating.

The atmosphere was great, and the staff were very friendly.
The meatball hero sandwich was delicious!
However, I didnâ€™t enjoy the classic meatballs in tomato sauce as much â€” the meatballs were too large, and the sauce tasted a bit plain.

Landed here forâ€¦ you guess it, spaghetti meatballs and ended up getting some. Taste was good, price was fair, service nice and friendly. Good place for either lunch or dinner, would have no concerns suggesting it to anyone.
I loooove this place. But bring back my lasagna to the menu!!!! ğŸ˜‚ğŸ’–ğŸ’–ğŸ’–

Iâ€™m glad that there is still one location of the Meatball Shop restaurants still in business. I went to the original location that was on Stanton Street between Orchard and Allen Streets for my birthday in December 2011. Delicious meatballs, spaghetti and tomato sauce and ice cream sandwiches for dessert. Also love the artwork adorning the walls. Staff was very friendly

Meatballs...boring? No way!!! This restaurant has a variety of meatballs and sauces and pastas where you can select all three. Spicy, traditional, or many other options exist, with flavors you may not have thought about in a meatball dish. And of course, don't forget the classic meatball hero. One word...yum!!
We stopped by The Meatball Shop for Happy Hour and ordered the small pasta. For $14, it was really disappointing â€“ very small portion. Totally overpriced ğŸ‘ğŸ¼ğŸ‘ğŸ¼ğŸ‘ğŸ¼ğŸ‘ğŸ¼
Me encanta este lugar!! Siempre voy. Muy rica la comida y muy bien de precio y te atienden genial.
Iconic NYC eatery, so glad this location is still around. The special dishes are fantastic!

Was taken right in and sat at the bar. Was kindly treated right away. I explained what I saw someone else eating when I walked in and bartender went to see what it was so he could tell me. Food came out quick and hot! Had the Antipasti Meatballs which were amazing and also had the Goat Cheese Beet Salad.
Held a private event here and the meatball shop was able to accommodate my budget. The food was great and the staff were friendly and attentive. Would definitely recommend for a private event!
I had the calamari and rigatoni. It was very good. The service was great. 4/5 would recommend. The sauce was rich and spicy. The portion size was good.
Quality  food at a good price
I come to NYC every few years and I always come back here. There used to be 6 or 7 of these around the city but this is the last one left. Incredible food!
Nous avons Ã©tÃ© trÃ¨s bien reÃ§us dans ce restaurant et avons appreciÃ© les pates au boulettes de viande. Attention câ€™est trÃ¨s copieux.

The meatballs here are fantastic! We had the classic beef with Parmesan cheese sauce â€” not my usual pick (Iâ€™m more of a classic tomato fan), but it was still a surprisingly delicious combo. Service was a little slow considering the place wasnâ€™t very busy, but we had time to relax, so it wasnâ€™t a big issue. Overall, the meatballs were worth it, and Iâ€™d definitely come back to try more.
Almondigas buenisimasss, una salsa de tomate muy buena, una pena que no tengan tanta variedad como antiguamente en el otro local.
Fantastic food and service. Checked on us multiple times during the meal and glass never went empty. 10/10
Excelente bocadillo de albÃ³ndigas. Todos los platos tienen Meat ball. Calidad A de comida

I really wanted to love this place. I came to The Meatball Shop on the strength of TikTok recommendations, expecting comfort food with bold flavor and a cozy vibe. Unfortunately, it fell short in just about every area except service.

I spent $28 on what felt like a very thrown together plate. Iâ€™ve had $10 pasta from casual spots that tasted way more intentional. The pasta was just okay..not overcooked, but definitely underwhelming. The meatballs themselves were a bit spicy, which I usually love, but here it was more like bland heat. No depth, no real flavor payoff. It was missing seasoning, herbs, sauce richness just vibes and heat.

The restaurant was completely empty when I went, which was surprising given the hype. That alone made the atmosphere feel a little off. On the bright side, the bartender was super sweet and attentive, which honestly was the highlight of the experience. Props to them.

Overall, the food didnâ€™t match the price, the flavor didnâ€™t match the expectations, and the hype definitely didnâ€™t translate in real life. Might be a better spot for drinks or apps if youâ€™re already nearby, but I wouldnâ€™t go out of my way for it again.

This has always been a required stop anytime I visit NYC. Used to go to the shop that was near Greenwich village but I guess it closed but the one in Hell's Kitchen was still great. Slightly better venue too
They didnâ€™t have the classic spaghetti meatballs that we were so excited about :/ pesto was great!
The food was great and the service amazing
Literally the best meatball Iâ€™ve ever tasted.

This is a fantastic place. We went for happy hour and our bartender Anthony was fantastic.  He recommended some of the food items off the happy hour menu and we were very happy with the tasteful selections.   We will be back!
Always have a great time at the Shop!
Love the vibes!
Super buenas meat balls me riquisimas pidan la salsa spicy ish buenisima y Lucas nuestro mesero era extremadamente amable felicitaciones por tener meseros con esa energia
Sell you one thing and try to serve another and try to make you feel bad about bringing it up.

La comida fue fenomenal una cosa deleitosa pa un paladar bueno pero rÃºstico serÃ© breve  da hacen honor y mÃ©rito d su nombre no hay otro dejo esto por aki kerril el amigo se portÃ³ a la altura tan igual como la comida Thank You Men

The server was friendly and at first glance it seemed like a great meatball placement. However, after I quickly got the meatballs and took a bite, my oponion quickly changed. While in New York I tried many different meatballs and thought New York couldn't possibly ever have bad meatballs. This was quickly falsified the moment I entered the Meatball Shop. The meatballs were not warm and they were as solid as a rock. The meatballs were not disgusting, but they weren't good either. Just hard slobs of untasteful meat. I would not recommend going there.
Amazing food, even better service and overall dining experience! The staff my Momâ€™s birthday celebration the best one yet!

2025 update:

The quality of the place has exponentially declined and gratuity for a table for 4 is just criminal.

Sorry but yâ€™all just lost another customer.

All the best trying to keep the restaurant open and running.

â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”

Goto pasta place.
Perhaps some of the best spicy sauce and pesto sauce pastas in the city!
While youâ€™re there - try the garlic bread with additional mozzarella cheese on top! Itâ€™s served with some of the best marinara youâ€™ll ever taste!!
The meatballs are okay, everything else was super oily and bad. Service was fine

We got seated right away. We were a party of six and they had no problems feeding us. The server was very kind and very nice. He continually checked on us and asked us if he needed anything. It took about 5 minutes before he took drinks and food. The OG was very good and it came with a Caesar salad that was delicious. I would not recommend the rigatoni with pesto unless you're getting it. As aside. It is very filling. Also, the tables were very sticky. Overall, I would recommend this if you need a quick place to eat.

Went to The Meatball Shop for bottomless brunch, and while the vibe was cute, the mimosas wereâ€¦ a choice. I asked if they could do mine with a little less OJ (because hello, I came for the bubbles, not a Vitamin C overdose), but the waiter very sweetly told me they follow a strict measurement and couldnâ€™t possibly adjust it. I was like, â€œNo worries!â€â€”but then my next mimosa came out even juicier than the first. Like, was the prosecco even invited to the party?

I get having a policy, but if your mimosas are 90% orange juice and 10% regret, maybe rethink the ratioâ€”especially when so many other spots are way more generous with the bubbly.

Food was solid, service was kind, but if you're brunching for the buzz... you might leave more hydrated than tipsy.
Very nice little spot with good food.

Unfortunately the meatball shop isnâ€™t what it used to be. We hadnâ€™t been back in 8 years since visiting NY. It was the first place we wanted to have dinner when we landed and unfortunately everything just felt like reheated frozen food or lacked flavor. They used to have several locations and theyâ€™ve all closed expect for this one, which makes me think that the quality has definitely fallen. I will say our server Ka Shaun was great and attentive.
I would like to know how to make salmon meatballs w canned Alaskan pink
We got the chicken parm meatball sandwich on brioche. 10/10. Dine in required reservations, so we sat at the bar. Drinks and bartender also were great.
The food is great, portions are large enough, service is kind and attentive. It is a great place.
Amazing food and great service, pork meatballs with rigatoni and tomato sauce didnâ€™t disappoint

Great spot in HK for a delicious, casual meal.  They have a small menu that focuses on what they are good at- meatballs!  They are proud of sourcing quality meats and it shows.  Try the chicken with pesto!!

Nous avions rÃ©servÃ© pour 9h.
Musique assourdissante Ã  lâ€™interieur.
Nous prenons 3 Meatballs qui Ã©taient trÃ¨s salÃ©es et nâ€™avaient rien dâ€™exceptionnel.
Ã€ 10h, alors quâ€™il restait des clients la serveuse commenÃ§ait Ã  passer le balai puis la serpilliÃ¨re.
Nourriture insipide, service Ã  revoir, la moins bonne expÃ©rience de notre sÃ©jour New Yorkaisâ€¦

I was totally disappointed in this restaurant. I ordered three meatballs that comes with tomato sauce for $15. They were not served hot. I don't expect a restaurant to make the meatballs right after I order them. I realize that they are premade at the restaurant earlier that day. I do expect them to heat them when I order them. This restaurant did not, the kitchen sent them out to me at room temperature with heated tomato sauce on top of them. After one bite I could tell that was the case and sent them back. They sent them out to me again after they had heated both.

If youâ€™re looking for a place that serves great meatballs with fast service, this spot is worth a visit. The food was flavorful and well-prepared, and the pricing felt reasonable given the location. Itâ€™s the kind of place where you can enjoy a satisfying meal without breaking the bank. Perfect for a quick bite or a casual outing. Would definitely recommend!

The Chelsea location was where I initially discovered this place and really enjoyed their food. However when I tried the Hellâ€™s Kitchen location I was disappointed to see the hostess have zero etiquette when she sat us by suggesting we leave in UNDER AN HOUR since other reservations would be filing in shortly after. (I hadnâ€™t even sat down yet.) Against my better judgment I still dined here and do regret it  - I think this place could use better mannerisms and their food is not what it used to be. Iâ€™ve had better. Never going here or speaking highly of this place again. ğŸ‘

Iâ€™ve been here around 2017 and I had a great memory of the experience. Iâ€™ve been partly deceived. I remembered I customised experience, very close to the customer. Today itâ€™s a normal restaurant. The waiter do not even mentioned the fact that you can choose the meat in the meatballs (I had to ask). Anyway, they have special service for the children and the pork meatballs are always super! Probably they lost that personal touch they have some years ago. It still with the food.

We love the meatball shop. Always enjoyed a good vegetarian meal at their Brooklyn establishment which had closed down so we were very happy after our Broadway show to be able to enjoy our meal at this location. Choice of sides and appetizers are plentiful  for vegetarians. Roasted cauliflower and potato salad. Vegetarian meatballs are delicious. Cold beers are refreshing and the Ben & Jerry ice cream with choice of cookie sandwich was a delicious finish to our meal!

These are some amazing New York City meatballs! The vibes and service here were amazing. We went before a terminal 5 show so there were other concert goers here too. The food is amazing all the meatballs combos are fun and the waitressâ€¦

We visited NYC just to go to the Meatball Shop in Chelsea at least 3 times prior to Covid. We were sad to see that it is no longer there, but happy to find this location. Three of us had reservations but were able to be seated early. We ordered spiked lemonade and started with Mozzarella Balls and tomato sauce which were fantastic. We ordered the Ball trio sampler with pork, beef, and chicken balls, and balls on pasta in a bowl. For the first time ever, we made it to dessert, although we also shared that 3 ways. Ice cream sandwich on a snickerdoodle, WHAT!! The Meatball Shop does not disappoint!!

1st time here, and was so impressed at the atmosphere. There's outdoor dining, which today was a beautiful day. Aside from construction across the street, but the food was delicious. Quality fresh food. Chicken was soft and tender, Meatball was so soft and flavorful. everything was spectacular. Service was top-tier. Thank you so much!! Will definitely return when I'm around the area.

Delicious meatballs or perfect balls (vegan option available) and sides that you can build your own dish or just sample a meatball on its own.
We did a walk in on a Friday night and were seated right away.
Great cocktails and drinks menu, served very efficiently too.
The servers are all super friendly and will make you feel very welcome.

This sustainable farm to table restaurant focuses on different varieties of meatballs with mix and matching opportunities. More tapas inspired with the rest of the food being meant to complement the meatballs. Noise was high and the lighting inside was generally low. Service was patient and assisted with recommendations though waiting for a check to longer than expected. If visiting my party of 4 preferred the chicken as their favorite meatball choice while turkey was decent.

We had planned to eat here on our 1st night in NY but never got there. On our final night, none of us were hungry but I wanted to go there before leaving. It did not disappoint! The staff were super friendly, the food was really great, we had the meatballs in 3 ways, chicken parm which we had never had before and lasagne. All 3 were excellent, very tasty, and homemade. Great to try new dishes that we do not have back in Belgium.  And for those who think you can only have burgers and pizza in the US, you are wrong.  Highly recommended! Hell's Kitchen is the best place in town. No tourist traps and frequented by locals.

Very intimidating service here. Didn't feel welcome at all by the lady staff ,despite the entire place being empty at 1 pm on a Friday.

Food was average. Had the meatballs. Don't know why people are giving star reviews for this place. The mashed potatoes were nice tho.
Would never return here again

Very fond of this place! The meatballs that come with the spaghetti are huge. It would be great if there was an option to choose your combination of meatballs + flavors, though, in case thereâ€™s one vegetarian in a party that wants to share. (Currently you can only choose one type besides the existing combos.) While I donâ€™t see myself going too often, I would recommend it to anyone considering going.

We love this place. Its a local favorite with tons of friendly faces. Both the large and small plates have a lot to offer. I do not eat pork, so I was pleased to see a lot of chicken/beef/lamb options offered on their menu.

Note: this is not a paid ad. We were shooting some images for a local news piece and the staff just welcomed us in! They even jumped in some photos with us! Itâ€™s so nice to see there are still amazing neighborhood restaurants you can find this kind of experience in.
I went here for my 41st birthday with my best friend. I had been there before but it was my friends 1st time. He loved it so much he bought a jar if their red sauce

Posto carino, all'angolo di un palazzo.
Ho preso 4 meatballs di pollo con polenta, che ho trovato buone, ma sarebbero state migliori se fossero stati un po' piÃ¹ generosi col sugo di pomodoro.
Un buon servizio anche se forse un filino lento ( tranne quando si Ã¨ trattato di portarci il conto...ğŸ™‚).
Prezzo finale in due ( una bottiglia da un litro di acqua San Pellegrino piÃ¹ due piatti come quelli che ho descritto, e cioÃ¨ 4 polpette e polenta come da foto) 66 dollari, mancia inclusa.
Per New York onesto.

El sitio estÃ¡ muy bien, en un barrio bastante normal. La comida esta rica y fueron rÃ¡pidos en servirnos. Anthony fue muy amable con nosotros y nos trato genial. Las raciones muy buenas, te ponen agua del grifo nada mÃ¡s sentarte y la cerveza es econÃ³mica.

A good variety of sauce to go with the meatballs. My favorite one is the white bean broccoli meatless meatball with pesto sauce. Spicy meat sauce also tastes delicious. Wish it could be less salty though. Fish of the day was a bit fishy though, maybe we didnâ€™t have the luck that day. The side fried cauliflower is too oily:(

This place is now a must do whenever we're in Manhattan. I saw it on a TV show of "best things I've had" and it was in the area we were staying. Absolutely delicious! Best meal of our trip. Didn't wait very long for a table despite it being a Saturday night. The chicken parm made two full meals for me (which I wasnt mad about), the risotto was to die for (wish I could eat it everyday), and my husband's trio sampler was the perfect amount of food for him while sharing the side. Highly recommend to anyone who enjoys a hearty meal when it's cold out. The service was wonderful too!

This place was recommended by the concierge at our hotel and did not disappoint. Itâ€™s fairly small so if you really want to go here, make a reservation. That being said, our food arrived VERY quickly so youâ€™ll also probably be able to get in without a reservation. We ordered the carafe of Chianti for $19 which I HIGHLY recommend, it was very high quality. My mom ordered the chicken pesto cavatappi which was delicious. There were at least 6-7 meatballs in it and the cheese was delicious. I ordered the kitchen sink which comes with your choice of meatballs and sauce with sides the chef picked. I will say, I was expecting the sides to be hot and they were cold but they were still really good. The side salad had a nice flavor, the carrots were caramelized and the broccoli had nice seasoning. Our waiter, Hunter, was also very good and checked on us often. His attitude was just so positive that it really rounded out the night. I would definitely come here again and recommend that you do as well!

Visited this restaurant as part of our hell's kitchen food tour. As our tour guide said this is the only meatball place in Hell's kitchen, so if you are in mood for meatballs then this is the place to go. Ambience is nice, service isâ€¦

Ooooo wee been waiting to try this place. It did not disappoint. Started with the Mini Buffalo Balls and WOW. I could eat 3 servings of those things. The Fig & Pig Flatbread was incredible. Bread was crisp and the balsamic glaze was theâ€¦

The food was fantastic!! Flavourful, and really good. The vibe was there all night and the service was really great. The food was upmarket, but 1 dish could split for 3 people so choose things to share.

Dropped by on a Friday night, the staff were friendly, atmosphere was casual and loud. The meatballs were very tasty, we ordered the mini buffalo balls, ball trio sampler, kale, zucchini and the mac & cheese. Would recommend!
